name: St. Juan Diego

locations.description: Visionary of Our Lady of Guadalupe in Mexico City

summary: Juan Diego was an indigenous Mexican who received the apparitions of Our Lady of Guadalupe in 1531. He is the first indigenous saint from the Americas. The Virgin Mary appeared to him on Tepeyac Hill and asked that a church be built there. His tilma (cloak) bearing the miraculous image of Our Lady of Guadalupe remains preserved in the Basilica of Guadalupe in Mexico City.
